title: EL MERCADO DE LOS MUERTOS
style_prefix: Children's book illustration, warm painterly style with soft brush strokes. NO TEXT IN IMAGE.

character_refs.riley: Riley - girl with straight dark hair, pink bow, purple dress with white stars

scenes.script: The friends visited Frances on her front porch. The afternoon sun was warm and golden. 'We have learned a lot about markets,' said Layla. 'But something still feels missing.'
scenes.prompt: Four friends visiting Frances on her cozy front porch. Golden afternoon light. Layla speaking thoughtfully. Warm welcoming scene.

scenes.script: Frances nodded with understanding. 'You have learned how markets work,' she said. 'Now you need to learn why they matter.' She settled back in her rocking chair.
scenes.prompt: Frances in rocking chair, nodding wisely. About to share important story. Friends listening attentively. Afternoon porch setting.

scenes.script: Frances's eyes got soft and far away. 'When I was nine, my abuelita took me to Mexico,' she began. 'Close your eyes. Smell the flowers.'
scenes.prompt: Frances with distant remembering expression. Friends closing eyes imaginatively. Memory about to begin. Soft warm light.

scenes.script: The porch faded away. Bright colors appeared everywhere. Orange and purple and gold! They were in a Mexican town square. This was the market before Día de los Muertos.
scenes.prompt: Magical transition - porch fading into vibrant Mexican plaza. Explosions of orange marigolds, purple, gold. Día de los Muertos market atmosphere.

scenes.script: Young Frances held her grandmother's hand. Her eyes were wide with wonder. 'Abuelita, why is everything so orange?' she asked.
scenes.prompt: Young Frances holding Abuelita's hand, looking around in wonder at all the orange marigolds. Child's amazement at vibrant scene.

scenes.script: They walked to a flower stall. Mountains of orange marigolds filled the air with sweet smell. The vendor smiled at Abuelita. 'Doña Elena! Your flowers are waiting!'
scenes.prompt: Flower stall piled high with orange marigolds. Friendly vendor greeting Abuelita by name. Sweet fragrant atmosphere. Personal connection.

scenes.script: Young Frances asked why they needed so many flowers. Abuelita explained gently. 'The bright color and sweet smell guide the spirits home. These are not just pretty. They are a path.'
scenes.prompt: Abuelita explaining meaning of marigolds to young Frances. Gentle teaching moment. Spiritual significance of flowers. Love and tradition.

scenes.script: They visited a woman making sugar skulls. She decorated each one with a name. 'Tell me their names,' she said. 'I write them here so they know we remember.'
scenes.prompt: Sugar skull vendor decorating skulls with names. Colorful calaveras with icing details. Abuelita telling names. Young Frances watching.

scenes.script: Young Frances realized these were not just candy. They were tributes. Each skull was for someone who had died. Someone loved. She touched one very gently.
scenes.prompt: Young Frances gently touching a sugar skull with new understanding. Reverent moment. Realizing the meaning behind the tradition.

scenes.script: They bought candles for the ofrenda at home. 'Each flame is a prayer,' the vendor said. 'Your prayer is the light that guides them through the dark night.'
scenes.prompt: Candle vendor explaining meaning to young Frances and Abuelita. Many candles glowing. Spiritual significance. Light and remembrance.

scenes.script: They bought pan de muerto from the bakery. Special bread shaped like bones. The baker gave young Frances a taste. It was sweet.
scenes.prompt: Bakery with pan de muerto displays. Baker giving young Frances a taste of the special bread. Sweet moment. Traditional shapes.

scenes.script: As they walked, Abuelita shared something important. 'Everything here was made by hand with love,' she said. 'That is what gives these things power.'
scenes.prompt: Abuelita and young Frances walking through market. Abuelita sharing wisdom. Handmade crafts all around. Love in every creation.

scenes.script: Young Frances helped pick papel picado and fabric. She chose purple and gold. 'These were Abuelo's favorite colors,' she said. 'I want him to see them.'
scenes.prompt: Young Frances choosing purple and gold papel picado and fabric. Making personal choices to honor her grandfather. Meaningful selection.

scenes.script: Later, the family built their ofrenda together. They placed flowers, candles, photos, skulls, and bread. Everyone helped. It was for love.
scenes.prompt: Family building ofrenda altar together. Photos, candles, marigolds, sugar skulls, pan de muerto arranged lovingly. Community of family. Love visible.

scenes.script: The memory faded softly. Frances was back on her porch. The friends were quiet. Some things are not made to be sold. They are made to mean something.
scenes.prompt: Magical transition back - Mexico fading. Frances on porch again with quiet, moved friends. Profound lesson absorbed. Soft light.

scenes.script: Benny sat very still. This was not like him. His eyes were wet. 'I never thought about who we remember,' he said quietly. 'It is important.'
scenes.prompt: Benny sitting unusually still, emotional. Moved by the story. Eyes wet. Deep feelings. Growth moment for usually energetic character.

scenes.script: Riley had been drawing while she listened. She looked up with excitement. 'What if our market had something like that?' she asked. 'We could make things that mean something.'
scenes.prompt: Riley looking up from sketchpad with excited idea. Sharing vision with friends. Connecting story to their market. Creative spark.

scenes.script: The friends encouraged her. Riley showed her sketch. Paper marigolds. Memory cards. A place where people could honor someone special. 'You should lead this part,' said Layla.
scenes.prompt: Riley showing sketchpad with paper marigold and memory card designs. Friends looking impressed. Layla encouraging her to lead. Support.

scenes.script: Riley smiled with new confidence. She had shared her idea, and people liked it! She could lead the memory station at their Community Market.
scenes.prompt: Riley smiling with newfound confidence. Friends celebrating her idea. Leadership moment. Her creativity valued and recognized.

scenes.script: Frances watched them with warm eyes. 'Now you understand,' she said. 'The market is not just about trading things. It is about sharing what matters most.'
scenes.prompt: Frances watching friends with warm proud expression. Key lesson delivered. Friends finally understanding deeper purpose of markets. Golden light.
